chargeHist.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel A Zimmer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault), a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.025(1)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Court costs paid from bond posted.

-Assessment/counseling/treatment as deemed appropriate. 
-Absolute sobriety.
-No controlled substances or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription.
-Random tests.
-Submit DNA sample, pay surcharge.
-Def may not enter establishments who's main purpose is to sell alcohol.
-No contact with the victim or her family, no contact with victim on 15CM212 without prior approval of agent, no contact with anyone under the age of 18 unless prior approval of the agent.
-Pay supervision fees.

Defendant Daniel A Zimmer in court with attorney Susan Marie Roth.  Patricia Bradford appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea questionnaire filed. State recommends 12 years in prison - 4 yrs initial confinement with 8 yrs extended supervision. Court examines defendant, accepts guilty plea and finds defendant guilty. Attorney Adam Gerol appears for the State. Counsel requests to adjourn for sentencing.  Defendant remanded into custody. Court orders a pre-sentence investigation.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

State by DA Adam Gerol.  Defendant in custody & appearing by video conferencing from the Ozaukee County Jail and by Atty Dejunco.  Counsel advises the defendant does not qualify for public defender representation.  Court examines defendant on the penalties in the complaint.  Court advises the defendant of the right to counsel.  State requesting $5000 cash bail w/conditions.  Court orders $3000 cash bail w/conditions:  no contact with J.P.; no unsupervised contact with anyone under the age of 18.  Atty Dejunco advises defendant requesting status of prelim hrg.  Court orders matter adj to 1/7 at 8:30 am for status of prelim hrg.
Dispatch advises defendant is in custody.
